PageTitle: reset ipv6 nd multicast-suppress dynamic bridge-domain
FuncDef: The reset ipv6 nd multicast-suppress dynamic bridge-domain command clears dynamic proxy ND entries in a specified BD. The reset ipv6 nd multicast-suppress dynamic bridge-domain command clears dynamic proxy ND entries in a specified BD. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: reset ipv6 nd multicast-suppress dynamic bridge-domain [ <bd-id> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of the BD in which dynamic proxy ND entries are deleted.

 NOTE: This parameter is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
The bd-id value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16777215.

Examples: <HUAWEI> reset ipv6 nd multicast-suppress dynamic bridge-domain 10
ExtraInfo: When the number of dynamic proxy ND entries exceeds a specified threshold, run the reset ipv6 nd multicast-suppress dynamic bridge-domain command to clear dynamic proxy ND entries in a specified BD.
